• فهرست سوره ها

به نام خدا، بخشنده‏‌ترین، مهربانترین
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

01 Quran Study From Azhar 1 Sura 72;19 28 & Sura 73 By Kathryn Jinns 05 26 1989

The messenger: Our teacher is Catherine. The new translation, page 573.

0:06 Catherine: And if you don't have your new translation, it's page 415 in Quran.

0:15 Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem. [72:19] When GOD's servant advocated Him alone, almost all of them banded together to oppose him.

0:24 [72:20] Say, "I worship only my Lord; I never set up any idols besides Him." [72:21] Say, "I possess no power to harm you, nor to guide you." [72:22] Say, "No one can protect me from GOD, nor can I find any other refuge besides Him. 0:40 [72:23] "I'm here to deliver proclamations from God as well as His messages." Those who disobey GOD and His messenger incur the fire of Hell, wherein they abide forever. 0:51 [72:24] Once they see what is awaiting them, they will find out who is really weaker in power, and fewer in number. 0:57 [72:25] Say, "I do not know if what is promised to you will happen soon, or if my Lord will delay it for awhile." 1:03 [72:26] He is the Knower of the future; He does not reveal the future to anyone. [72:27] Only to a messenger that He chooses, does He reveal from the past and the future, specific news. 1:14 [72:28] This is to ascertain that they have delivered their Lord's messages. He is fully aware of what they have. He has counted the numbers of all things. 1:25 Verse 19, [72:19] When GOD's servant advocated Him alone, almost all of them banded together to oppose him. 1:35 All of God's servants have said the same thing and say the same thing "worship God alone." 1:44 They never asked that people worship them, follow them, do as they do, act as they do, speak as they do. They only say "worship God alone, no other idols beside Him." 2:00 Why people become uncomfortable with the message is we know the reason but it's 2:06 still a puzzle when we run into people who seem uncomfortable with that statement 2:12 we all have family and old friends and colleagues who are surprised by us when we state that message and state that that's what we believe. 2:24 There are verses in the Quran and one in particular which says that when God alone is advocated, the hearts of disbelievers shrink in aversion and you can watch that 2:34 happen. It is though people shrink. They become smaller almost in a very real sense. And it's their ego that gets in the way. It's here. Something so simple as God alone is so frightening to so many people. They believe that they have to have control and they have to understand and they have to know and they have to be the one who calls the shots. 3:01 In addition to that, if someone like themselves is saying this message, it's an excuse and an easy way to avoid the message for many people. Again, the ego takes over and will say 3:15 "why this person? I'm no different from this person or that person is no better than me. I don't have to listen to them." And so the message is rejected. We are fortunate enough, and I mean 3:30 very fortunate enough. Speaking for myself, I have no idea why I was chosen to be here in Tucson. I know how I came. I can relate that story to... 3:41 but there are many of us who have the same story to tell. I know why I am very fortunate to 3:50 be here where this perpetual miracle continues to unravel before our eyes. 3:58 Rashad said the other day that he didn't... God has thickened our skin over the last 10 years and if we don't 4:06 faint or lose consciousness every time something like this incredible numbers on the wall or the things that Abdullah explained today or explained to us. We just sit here. Now we nod our heads and some of us get teary but we stay conscious 4:21 And we say "oh, this is just more of the same." And I went home, my own self today is saying "it seems that no matter what we do with the numbers, they're always gonna be a multiple of 19." 4:31 And that the complexity of this code is so great that it can never be understood by us. And that's why it's given in piece after piece after piece. And so many of us, how fortunate, are able to be part of discovering another part of the prism. 4:49 The message is "worship God alone." It's so loud at this point that it's almost hard to pay attention to those people who don't wanna listen to the most elementary statement of "worship God alone." 5:05 The servants of God carry the message "I worship only my Lord. I never set up any idols beside Him." 5:15 They also always say "I am a human being like you. Do not worship me." And they point out their humanness. "I possess no power to 5:27 harm you nor to guide you. No one can protect me from God, nor can I find any other refuge besides Him." 5:34 "I am a human like you. I make no superhuman claims. I have no magic." Because, however, the servants of God have been given special information 5:45 and special (unintelligible), they're more vulnerable and their responsibility is even greater than for those of us who have not had that opportunity, who have not been chosen. And also the servants of God, and Rashad is a wonderful 6:01 example but so were the others in the Quran, are also less vulnerable because God protects these people. And we've seen that all the way through Quran, Moses, Jesus, all of them, Elias, John. They've all been protected by God as long as they carried the one message. 6:17 They never claimed to be anything more than a messenger. So, the humanist is constantly poor people and still they shrink and still they say 6:28 to the message, messenger, when it was Noah, was Rashad, or he or you "Uh-uh, who're you? You're a human being. You don't bring anything special. And I don't see any miracle." Well, It's a sorting process, thank God it is. It is always a place where pattern never changes. 6:49 Verse 23 [72:23] "I'm here to deliver proclamations from God as well as His messages." Those who disobey GOD and His messenger incur the fire of Hell, wherein they abide forever. 7:00 The only unforgivable sin is idol worship, the only. And God is so clear that we have so many chances. As long as we live, we have chances to repent and to come back to God and get on God's path. 7:14 If we worship anything other than God, anyone other than God, God never will forgive this. This verse is not a threat by a human being, by a messenger. 7:26 This is from God Almighty saying always within Quran, whether it is a quote out of a messenger's mouth in a verse or whether it is a description in a narrative. 7:38 Hell is where the idol worshippers will go. 7:45 Once they see what is awaiting them, they will find out who's really weaker in power and fewer in number. It's too late. It is. 7:54 Once you see it's too late if an angel was sent down with all of this wonderful stuff that we don't lose consciousness over every week, we wouldn't have needed any of it. 8:08 It's too late once you know. Rashad was talking about the fact the other day that people know at the time of their deaths where they're going. It is too late 8:18 for people to say "let me go back. Let me have a second chance. I understand now what I'm supposed to do." 8:24 No, because God knows that once we're put back here, we revert to the same thing, the same forgetful mind that we came here with in the first place. And the phrase "who is really weaker in power and fewer in number" 8:37 we know that it is the minority of the minority of the minority, I mean, it's as long as a tunnel into the few that will make it into Heaven as it is in this code itself. It seems to be a mirror image. 8:52 Those few people that do make it even to Purgatory, that's, if you're hanging on by your toe nails in Purgatory, you made it. Those few people are really the strong ones, they're really the mightier in number. No matter how else it appears, but it counts in the real world. 9:13 [72:25] "I do not know if what is promised to you will happen soon, or if my Lord will delay it for awhile." [72:26] He is the Knower of the future; He does not reveal the future to anyone. 9:24 Again, pointing to the fact that all messengers are human beings. They are not God. Only God knows the past, the future. We read history books and think that we have history. We think we understand what's happening. I'm willing to bet anything 9:41 that in the Hereafter when we discover what history really was in that whatever particular era that we think we know so much about, 9:49 all the little details that we didn't have access to. It's going to be vastly different and much (unintelligible), at the same time. I have... when I was reading this over this past week, I wrote that human being does not have 10:04 any idea what he wants. The human being doesn't know the future. Jesus didn’t know the future. Jesus doesn’t know this is happening now. We know who were them, Noah, Jesus, Moses and all of those that have gone before us sitting in this room. We know them well. 10:23 We have all the pieces, I think, unless (unintelligible), I mean, 10:29 we have so much more. How much greater is our responsibility? How much more less we have to search? I mean, this is irrefutable proof, touchable, examinable, verifiable. We have all the miracles that have gone for those who came after Noah. We know that now. Noah doesn't. We know about those who came after Moses and Moses doesn't 10:53 The human being doesn't know what he thinks he knows. What he is, he makes up. His own security is made up. And to predict the future is foolish. It's absolutely foolish. 11:08 [72:27] Only to the messenger that He chooses, does He reveal from the past and the future, specific news. 11:14 Other examples besides Rashad's own experiences, Joseph knew about the future. It was revealed to him that his father and mother and brothers would bow down to him later in life and he knew that even after his experience in the well and in prison. 11:33 Moses' mother was given information about him being saved and what would become of him. 11:42 Those are tests. Those are provisions for God's very special messengers. They remove the doubts of those chosen by God who are going to be delivering the message and facing incredible odds 11:56 and provide for insights for believers when they are doubting themselves and they have this ammunition put at their disposal. When Joseph announced to the people "I knew this was going to happen, you were going to be here, you were going to bow down." 12:13 There had to be more than just "oh thank God, he's not gonna kill us" in their minds. These people had to have understood God chose Joseph and this was all part of the plan for Joseph. 12:28 God tells us in 28 that He gives specific news and specific information to ascertain, make sure the messengers have delivered their Lord's 12:36 messages, that they've done it correctly. He's fully aware of what He has given them 12:42 to deliver and He has counted the numbers of all thing. It's already done. 12:49 Counting the numbers of all things always makes me think of the Khutba that Abdullah gave when he was talking about the trees and the leaves and the numbers of the leaves on trees and he got... at least for me, I got very 13:01 involved in counting the leaves of the one tree that he was describing and when he got all done with that, it took very long time. He moved on to just one other tree. It was awesome at that point to even contemplate counting. So, that reminds all of the words that we speak and we receive with our ears and see with our eyes. 13:23 And those things are all designed ahead of time. We think which we are choosing the words we're saying or not, it's part of the design for our lives to test to be efficient for all of us. 13:35 The messenger has the greatest responsibility of all of us due to the large quantity of proof provided to him. And that can be awesome and frightening. 13:49 Unless, of course, the messenger knows that he's fully supported by Allah alone in which case this is (unintelligible) lifetime 13:58 I can't imagine (unintelligible). I wanted to share with you before I stopped at this section talking about 14:08 messengers and God's servants. I overheard someone say, in trying to make a joke 14:13 recently, that their favorite saying was that God so loved the world He sent His only son. He didn't send a committee. And I remember... as I walked by, I 14:23 remember just kind of shuddering thinking "oh, yes, He did send a committee, a large committee of messengers and servants with many more to come (unintelligible)." 14:37 And I thought I would share that with you because there are many people who think that there's no committee around here. There's such a large committee ranges alone. 14:48 And therefore, (unintelligible). Are there any comments, questions, I hope? 15:12 It's different. These pages are from the new translation. Now, all of us have them. There weren't enough copies to go around. This is... the book that you're 15:22 using is the most recent. This one is going to be published very soon. And it's going to be the first time when the correct Quran has been in human hands in 1400 years. 15:34 So, we're opting to use the few pages until book comes out. You might wanna share with someone. 15:50 No, absolutely not. but says the same thing. Says "worship God alone." 16:15 The messenger: It's a long story. But it comes true as we explain these verses. 16:21 Why are we here. Why are we here. He wants to know why we're here. 16:33 (Unintelligible). 16:43 Mã Shã Allãh. Mã Shã Allãh. We're here, maybe, because we committed a crime. 16:52 When we were in the Heavenly Society, we sided with Satan. Satan wanted to be a god besides God and we did not oppose that. We did not make a good, firm stand with God, absolutely free. 17:08 So, this is why we're here to redeem ourselves and to change our way and denounce that stand by going back to upholding God's absolute authority 17:18 by knowing that nobody has any power to do anything except God. This is God's absolute authority. 17:25 People who think that Muhammad or Jesus or Mary or saints can do anything are in the same trap of committing the same crime and they will go on all the way to Hell. 17:36 We can be redeemed only if we change that and worship God alone. "Worship God alone" means knowing that God only has power to do anything. 17:52 You must know that God is the One who hires and fires. God is the only One who decides how many dollars are in your pocket. You must know that. You think that your boss is the one who hired you or fired you, or may fire you, provides for you. Then, you're in the same trap. So, this is why we are here for. Size of the soul. 18:17 I wanna go to the verse, it says, "once they see what..." that's 24 [72:24] Once they see what is awaiting them, they will find out who is really weaker in power, and fewer in number. 18:32 Cause out of all of Tucson, half a million people, only about 50 people come here to this mosque to worship God alone. 18:41 So, in this city, we appear to be 50 among half a million people. 18:48 There may be 50 more out there worship God alone under the name of Christianity or Judaism 18:56 but they do believe that God alone has all the power. So, that's 100 out of half a million. 19:02 This appears to be a minority. You see, you're walking around with your body that is visible. 19:10 They say "this is Catherine Robinson." But they don't see what she really looks like, what size she is. 19:17 We learn from Sura 17 that the differences in the Hereafter are far greater. The difference between Iman and Gatut is 40, but in the Hereafter the differences 19:33 are far more greater, Sura 17. So, your real size is as big as the city of Phoenix, for example. You're walking around, you see this size. Their size, the people who are not worshipping God alone, they actually shrink. 19:51 Their soul actually shrinks to the size of a cat. So, there are 100 people whose size is as big as the city of Phoenix, each one of them. 20:01 And half a million size ants. "who is really weaker in power, and fewer in number." 20:12 One man and a million ants, which one is really stronger? Where is the majority? Is it 20:18 the one, one person or the million ants? When you walk out the mosque, you can see one million ants sometimes. 20:27 Did you see them today? So, where is the majority? Some of them are clearly stated in future tense. 41:07 So, Quran is valid for all times. OK. Shall we move on to Sura 73? Please, Catherine. 41:19 Catherine: Sura 73: Cloaked In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful 41:26 [73:1] O you cloaked one. [73:2] Meditate during the night, except rarely. [73:3] Half of it, or a little less. [73:4] Or a little more. And read the Quran from cover to cover. [73:5] We will give you a heavy message. 41:37 [73:6] The meditation at night is more effective, and more righteous. [73:7] You have a lot of time during the day for other matters. [73:8] You shall commemorate the name of your Lord, to come ever closer and closer to Him. [73:9] Lord of the east and the west; there is no other god besides Him. You should choose Him as your advocate. 41:55 [73:10] And remain steadfast in the face of their utterances, and disregard them in a nice manner. [73:11] And let Me deal with the rejectors, who have been generously blessed; just give them a little time. [73:12] We have severe punishments, and Hell. [73:13] Food that can hardly be swallowed, and painful retribution. 42:14 [73:14] The day will come when the earth and the mountains will quake, and the mountains will turn into a weightless pile. [73:15] We have sent to you a messenger, just as we sent to Pharaoh a messenger. [73:16] Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger and, consequently, we punished him severely. [73:17] If you disbelieve, how can you evade a day so terrible that it makes the infants gray-haired? 42:33 [73:18] The heaven will shatter therefrom. His promise is true. [73:19] This is a reminder; whoever wills, let him choose the path to his Lord. 42:43 [73:20] Your Lord knows that you meditate during two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, and so do some of those who believed with you. GOD has designed the night and the day, and He knows that you cannot always do this. He has pardoned you. Instead, you shall read what you can of the Quran. He knows that some of you may be ill, others may be traveling in pursuit of GOD's provisions, and others may be striving in the cause of GOD. 43:07 You shall read what you can of it, and observe the contact prayers (Salat), give the obligatory charity (Zakat), and lend GOD a loan of righteousness. Whatever good you send ahead on behalf of your souls, you will find it at GOD far better and generously rewarded. And implore GOD for forgiveness. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful. 43:29 The name of this Sura is Cloaked. A cloak or cover can be a protection for us against weather 43:38 inclement weather, for instance. Or it can be a barrier or a veil, something that blinds us or deafens us. 43:51 And keeping that in mind, looking at verses 1 through 7, the night was designed for our rest. 44:00 There are no distractions during the night for us, certainly not like there are during the day when the world seems to wake up and pick up speed and get itself up to 300 miles an hour before the sunset. 44:13 This is a special time with Allah for us. It is a time when we, our own bodies and our own minds are winding down and there is space and peace about our... 44:24 The messenger: (unintelligible) Excuse me. 44:40 Catherine: And God is telling us that here any time that we spend reading the Quran, meditating is for our own good here. 44:51 God doesn't need for us to do this. God is in no need at all. And He's giving us an opportunity, guiding us to take advantage of an opportunity during our busy days in our lives 45:06 to spend time with Him. In verse 8, the reason for the guide, the hint of provision of day 45:15 we're working, night, we rest, for example, is God's consciousness, at 24 hours a day, is our goal, commemorating the name of our God 24 hours a day, every minute 45:30 so that every cell in our body, every thought in our mind is preceded by Allah. Alhamdu Lillah. Subhan Allah. Every chance we get out loud, no matter where we are. 45:43 What I have found to be amazing about that is when that became a habit of mine and I'm not quite sure when that was, sometimes someone will ask me what I'm saying. 45:55 Well, I can tell you how weird that is. Very few people ask me what it is I'm saying. Very few people are interested. I write Bism Allah on my checks, all of them. 46:10 Well, a lot of the things that I have to remember God for 24 hours a day, no matter what we do, no matter when we do it. 46:19 Verse 9, you should choose Him as your advocate. 02 Quran Study From Azhar 2 Sura 95 & Sura 96 By M Sabahi Two Verses Of Sura 9 Dropped Out To Demons

أعوذ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ The messenger: We seek refuge in God from Satan. He's after us. We are his main targets. 0:08 He doesn't care about the people who are out there drinking and gambling. They are disobeying God. He doesn't care about them. He doesn't bother with them. He's after us. God tells us so in the Quran. 0:21 "I will sit on their straight path, the right path." We seek refuge in God from him. 0:28 In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful. Our teacher tonight is Dr. Sabahi and his assistants are Dan, Ali and Amir. 0:37 A woman: No way! 0:44 The messenger: And we start with Sura Dr. Sabahi: 97. No, sorry, sorry. 95. I was just checking. 1:21 أعوذ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمٰنِ الرَّحِيْمِ In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful. 1:30 Dr. Sabahi: The Suras that we're covering tonight start with 95, Fig (Al-Teen). 1:43 It consists of 8 AYAs, overall. And one of the short Suras of the later, latest parts of the Quran. 1:55 When I was looking at this Sura and the previous Suras that we covered, I realized that there are quite a few Suras that God starts with 2:12 different things that He's swearing by them. One word before I go to Sura 96 27:53 The plants are overall one of the most amazing chemical factories that exist on the earth. For a while I was, before coming to US, I was involved with research on plants and 28:10 drugs that are derived from plants. And as a chemist, I was amazed to see how complex 28:23 these molecules are that you can take from a plant. As an example, I can tell you now is that the most effective cancer research 28:35 and the most effective compounds or agents against cancer thus far are the ones who have origins from plant materials. And China is one of the 28:48 leading countries in that respect. They invest a lot in national fund and research. And recently, there was a symposium. So, what happens is that the plants as time goes 29:01 by, they synthesize these things and you don't need too much chemistry to understand that the only 29:07 chemicals that are available to the plants are carbon dioxide, hydrogen from the ground and water. So, you have carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen and oxygen, these 4 29:19 basically nature elements and some possible other things that come from the ground. And this plant as you seed it and it grows, 29:28 starts to put these things together. And then after a while, you take it to chemist, leaves goes to lab 29:36 and tries to extract these chemicals out of it and then spends a lot of time, years maybe, 29:42 to see what is the structure. It started being one nitrogen, one oxygen, one hydrogen, billions of this in small pieces and then this plant has put these 29:51 together to gigantic molecules, all that patched together. First of all, human beings have a lot of trouble to identify 29:59 what the structure is because the definite structure of the plant is something that you need to know as a 30:07 chemist or as a pharmacist. So, after they find the structure of, they know the potency, they 30:15 try and say "OK. This is effective against this infection or cancer or whatever." Then, they wanna make you buy it so that they can introduce it to the market and give it to people. So, should they go and kill all the plants? 30:28 No, the chemists come into play. So, OK, they're gonna synthesize it, do this thing that the plant does slowly. It's designed to do it. And so they do it in the lab and start. One of the the third grade synthetic 30:42 chemists that was here a few month ago. He said "they have been working for 5 years. I mean, they have been, a group of top-notch scientists, working to synthesize the molecule that would be, as we've shown, has been tried out. And 30:58 as we've shown in the past that it has the potency against cancer. So, it took them at least five years and they had one step to do and that is the difference was the molecule that they were 31:10 synthesizing, was like the right glove of your hand that you can't put on your left hand. There's a difference. There's no way you can put on both your right and left hand, 31:23 or better understand, you cannot put a right glove on your left hand. Have you ever realized this? 31:29 That is a concept chemists call it Plurality. And that's one of the most amazing things that, in creation. And this is the only molecule, one molecule which is the right-handed molecule. It's really effective. The left-handedness is not effective at all. 31:45 The only difference is that if you look these are the mirror. If mirror is here, this is kind of exactly this hand's mirror image of... these molecules are mirror images of itself. But 31:57 one of them is as the cocaine as that property. If you take the same, exactly the same number of carbon, nitrogen, whatever. But the only difference is that the right glove instead of the left glove. It doesn't have to say it if you take a kill out of it, you get high. 32:12 And so I think when I read that that plants are such an amazing creatures that do things that, you know, we take for granted, we realize it 32:29 And this is another sign, another one of those signs. But I just always forget 50:15 this new discovery that came to us in the mail from Turkey and it has to do with verse 3:81. This 50:25 happens quite often in the Quran where you have a statement in the Quran and the opponents will come up 50:33 with something contradictory to it. But then God puts the answer to their claims somewhere else 50:43 in the Quran. For example, verse 3:81 talks about the Messenger of the Covenant. 50:50 It says that after all the prophets, and this is any translation will tell you about it. After all the prophets have 50:56 come to this world and delivered their scriptures and the messages, a messenger will come to 51:01 unify, purify, consolidate these messages into one. This is verse 3:81. When you show this to the 51:10 idol worshipers, they say "that one is Muhammad. That messenger of the Covenant is Muhammad." 51:17 Even though the verse is very clear that it is not Muhammad because it begins by saying "God made 51:24 a covenant with the prophets." We all recognize the Prophet Muhammad as a prophet, even they do. 51:32 He was the last prophet. Therefore, he must be included in that statement because God did not say" He 51:39 made a covenant with the previous prophets or the prophets before you." God said "He made a 51:45 covenant with the prophets." So, the answer to this claim is in 33:7 where God says "I made the covenant 51:56 with the prophets including you, Muhammad." So, this is at the very... at the other end of the Quran. So, 52:04 it shuts them up. Now, the discovery that Edip Yuksel made... Ismail Barakat: No, it doesn't, Rashad. It doesn't. Edip's friend in Turkey counted the verses from 3:81 to the answer to their 52:22 claim 33:7 and found that the number of verses is a multiple of 19. 3192. 52:29 The messenger: Yes. The Basmalah are verses. The Basmalahs are unnumbered verses, as we know, from this miracle on the wall where we did not 52:40 count them and the whole number is a multiple of 19. They put it in a computer, and the computer will count the number of stars in that area, in that picture. 24:51 And there's a formula that tells you what the circumference from the inside of a circle is. 24:57 And then you can tell from this picture how many are in the whole circumference of the whole sky. 25:06 And you do this a hundred times, and then you take the average of the hundred times, and you have exactly, almost exactly, the number of stars, A billion trillion of them. 25:16 And these are the ones that we see. This is what you need in this life. 45:18 And for these $800,000, you go to school and you work hard, and you're very polite to your teachers, so they give you a good grade, and they do anything they say. 45:31 "Come here 3 o'clock in the morning, we're having a special class." You're gonna study all night. 45:43 You do all this for the $800,000 that you need in this world. Now for 40 million years, God told you exactly what to do for your PRA, post-retirement account. 46:01 You have to advance the funds for your PRA, the most important period of your life. 46:10 Every prayer, every Contact Prayer, God gives you, let's say, a million dollars. It's actually more than that. 46:18 But God puts in your account a million dollars. You have to do the same for eternity. 47:00 Are you gonna have a decent life there forever? Are you going to be an honored person? Are you gonna be a humiliated person? 47:07 It is all in your hands. God left it up to you. You just deposited 10 billion dollars in your PRA account, no kidding. 1:11:08 You're all worth it. 07 Quran Study From Azhar 7 Sura 62 & Sura 63 By Kathryn God's Religion Will Dominate In 20 To 50 Yr The messenger: I think I need to start by making a momentous announcement. 0:08 As you know, the true Quran, the pure Quran, never existed in the past. 0:19 The Prophet Muhammad received the Quran and wrote it with his own hand. And the last Sura revealed, Sura number 110, was revealed in his Hajj pilgrimage 0:36 only a few months before he died. The last Sura revealed in Medina was Sura number 9. 0:46 So, the Prophet had the Quran written with his own hand in the chronological sequence, 0:54 with instructions on the side saying where every piece goes. That's all the Prophet had. 1:01 It was not the Quran that God intended for the world. 19 years later, during the era of Uthman, Islam had gone to Syria, and Iraq, and Egypt, 1:16 and Uthman wanted to make copies to send to those new Muslims in new countries. 1:23 So, he appointed a committee to carry out the Prophet's, God's instructions, to take that 1:32 original copy. By that time, it was with the Prophet's wife, Hafsa, Omar's daughter. 1:40 Uthman sent for it, and he gave it to the committee to carry out the instructions. 1:45 This piece goes here, this piece goes here. And put the Quran in the order that God intends for the world. 1:53 And I think you know the rest of the story where, when they finished, and they came to 2:00 the last Sura revealed in Medina, Sura 9, someone suggested to add a couple of verses 2:05 to honor the Prophet. So, they committed that big crime that caused the war between Ali and Uthman, and then the 2:17 war against Ali and his family, the Prophet's family, that ended with the eradication of 2:24 the Prophet's family in Karbala. And the winners were the Umayyads who put the two verses in the Quran. 2:36 So, the version that came to us about the war and the history of the Quran is the version of those so-called winners. 2:45 They thought they won the war. So, the announcement I want to make is that this is the last time we use this. 2:54 As of next week, we'll use the new translation. This is the announcement. 2:59 So, it will not be in the book form yet, but you will be handed the new translation to study. 3:07 This is the last time we use this. It's a historical day. But the new translation is gonna come out. It's gonna be hardcover. It's gonna be luxurious. 3:17 You see the page there? This is a very hazy cover. It's not a good one. 3:23 But it's gonna be sharp and it will be in gold stamp. The cover itself, the hardcover outside will be dark blue. 3:34 And it will be, for the first time in history, the pure Quran, in Arabic and in English. 3:42 So, as you know, some of you read the small booklet about the two verses. The Christians are humans and the Muslims are humans, and both of them fell for the trap 4:27 of Satan, and they started to idolize the Prophet against his will. 4:32 They invented an Azan that has... does not have the name of God alone. 4:39 The Prayer became distorted and did not have the name of God alone. And just to make a long story short, they did not deserve the pure Quran. 4:48 Now, there are people who devote their worship to God alone, and they uphold the Quran alone, 4:54 and these are the true Muslims. The true Muslims will have the true Quran. And this is really a historical event. 5:05 As you know, the famous statement in the Quran is that the month of Ramadan is when the Quran was revealed. 5:15 And this is exactly when the Quran is going to be completed and will be purified. 5:21 And it's gonna come out, gonna be sent to the press in Ramadan, IN SHAA ALLAH. And I know you believe me when I tell you that I didn't plan it this way. 5:31 It was not planned this way. Catherine: The Hypocrites (Al-Munaafeqoon) In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful 56:23 [63:1] When the hypocrites come to you they say, "We bear witness that you are the messenger of GOD."* GOD knows that you are His messenger, and GOD bears witness that the hypocrites are liars. 56:34 [63:2] Under the guise of their apparent faith, they repel the people from the path of GOD. Miserable indeed is what they do. 56:40 [63:3] This is because they believed, then disbelieved. Hence, their minds are blocked; they do not understand. 56:47 [63:4] When you see them, you may be impressed by their looks. And when they speak, you may listen to their eloquence. They are like standing logs. They think that every call is intended against them. These are the real enemies; beware of them. GOD condemns them; they have deviated. 57:01 [63:5] When they are told, "Come let the messenger of GOD pray for your forgiveness," they mockingly turn their heads, and you see them repel others and act arrogantly. 57:08 [63:6] It is the same for them, whether you pray for their forgiveness, or not pray for their forgiveness; GOD will not forgive them. For GOD does not guide the wicked people. 57:16 [63:7] They are the ones who say, "Do not give any money to those who followed the messenger of GOD, perhaps they abandon him!" However, GOD possesses the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not comprehend. 57:28 [63:8] They say, "If we go back to the city, the powerful therein will evict the weak (and we will be victimized)." (They should know that) all dignity belongs to GOD and His messenger, and the believers. However, the hypocrites do not know. 57:41 Verse 1, the footnote says "even though the hypocrites are uttering a truth, God calls them liars. 57:48 He teaches us that we must reject all fabrications attributed to the prophet in the name of Hadith even if such Hadith narrates a truth. 57:56 The fabrication of a good Hadith is the bait that Satan uses to cover a deadly hook. 58:03 There are many people who are very talented with words in their individual languages. 58:10 And how scriptures and Hadiths and the oral traditions in Jewish faith and so on came to be 58:20 was those human beings who were very talented with words took the truth and elaborated upon them to the point where they became 58:28 man-made laws, regulations, suggestions, traditions, 58:34 to the point where those became the truth that people followed as opposed to the real message which was at the core originally. 58:41 There is some truth, some veracity to what we hear in all things. 58:47 The test is to figure out where it is and what it is. So, this was the Quranic position. 1:03:40 The Quranic position is that every one of us, IN SHAA ALLAH, when we go to Heaven, will say "please God, I want my mother with me." 1:03:49 "I love her very much." Ok? And this is SHAFA'AT. You will say it. I will say it. Everyone will say it. IN SHAA ALLAH in Heaven. 1:03:58 Now, this SHAFA'AT is useful if the mother is a good person that is already going to Heaven. 1:04:06 If the mother was not to go to Heaven, this SHAFA'AT will not do any good. Therefore, it is really useless.But we will say it anyway, out of emotion. 1:04:15 So, this is the understanding of SHAFA'AT. And this is exactly what this verse was saying. 1:04:20 It is saying when the messenger asks for forgiveness, it will be accepted for the believers, but not for the hypocrites or the disbelievers. 1:04:31 Exactly. Because it's true. 1:04:37 Catherine: It's our human nature to do it. The messenger: Not because it's something that is... Because it's a fact. 1:04:49 The messenger: Yes. The messenger: Anybody can repent. I think this is a point that Catherine raised. 1:04:57 But if a person goes back from belief to disbelief, they can always repent and come back to it. 1:05:02 There are other verses in the Quran. Explains Evolution. “Species created independently”. Explains other Earths and we are “believing evolutionists”. 9:04 Number 12 is very important in this age of evolution, creation, debates. 9:10 Evolution is a divinely guided process. Evolution is a fact. 9:15 It is a scientific fact and it is a Quranic fact. I'm gonna have an appendix on it. 9:20 When you read the appendix, you'll see that evolution is perfectly all right. But it is a divinely guided process. 9:29 The fly has 4,000 lenses in each eye. 4,000. It did not evolve into 10,000. It didn't evolve into x-ray vision. 9:38 For millions of years, for millions of years, it is 4,000 lenses in each eye. 9:46 But there are varieties of flies. Within the same species, there is evolution, within the same species. 9:54 We got the navel orange out of the regular oranges. All of a sudden, we have this wonderful orange without any seeds, tastes good. 10:04 But it came from another orange tree, not from an apple tree. So, it's from the same species. There is evolution within the species. 10:11 But every species was created independently. But the point that I want to emphasize here that you need to remember is that God created seven earths identical to this earth. 10:22 And the statistical laws bear this out. But there is no life on them. 10:30 Because on the Day of Judgment, which is the most important day, that's the Eternal Day, when all the people past, present, and future will be there, 10:40 we will all be there and we will all witness that there were six other earths like this one, but no life on any of them. 10:47 Because what the evolutionists, the atheist evolutionists say, because we are believing evolutionists. They are atheist evolutionists. 10:58 The atheist evolutionists say that life evolved out of nothing here on this earth. 11:04 Because of the circumstances, because of the amino acids, the lightning, the ethylene, and all the other nitrogen and stuff. 11:13 A man: Is that the Big Bang Theory? So, what I'm saying is that the more knowledge the human being acquires, the closer they get to God's laws on their own. 19:34 Hamid: Aren't you gonna go as far as getting the advice of the judges because after all we are humans. 19:44 And when it comes to dividing your own wealth, you may, it will be better (unintelligible). So, I just listen to you and (unintelligible). 19:59 If someone has to pass a judgment on the wealth of a guy, if it's left up to the first man, 20:07 which is the man who is very wealthy, if someone has to step in and the wife brings the checkbook, 20:17 what do you think this would mean? 20:23 The messenger: Well, remember that believers' affairs are decided by consultation. We're talking about believers. 20:30 If they're believers, they will be fair, and they will consult, and they will maintain... 20:36 Again, in Sura 4, like Lori mentioned, God emphasizes the amicable relations. 20:42 So, a husband and wife didn't get along together and decided to part. They don't have to be enemies. 20:48 In fact, God says "you must maintain the amicable relations among you." So, there will be mutual consultation and mutual contentment. 20:57 Hamid: But realistically, you mentioned about alcohol. Yeah, it shouldn't be there. It should be prohibited. The messenger: Right. “Islamic Judges”. 21:04 Hamid: But the reality, I'm talking about... the nowadays life. I'm just imagining this. 21:14 The messenger: Hamid, you're hung up on the time of applicability of the Quran. The Quran is applicable through any time, till the end of the world. Not nowadays. 21:22 Hamid: Are you saying we do not need Islamic judges? Is that the content of the argument? Should we go to Istanbul? 21:33 The messenger: No, actually, we do need Islamic judges. I didn't say that. Yeah. 21:39 Because the general public will not be as familiar with the Quran as they should be, or as they need to be. You are being requited only for what you did. 24:04 In the first verse of the Sura, in the footnote, it says that Mohammedans around the world believe that Muhammad was infallible. This verse teaches us that he was indeed a fallible human being. 24:16 And there are a number of verses cited that will back this up. 24:24 The messenger is given the responsibility to deliver the messages, and when he does that, he is 24:31 in accordance with God's laws and those things are preserved. 24:38 But the messenger is also a human being and is subject to the same test that everybody else is subject to, an even greater test, because with the responsibility comes, you know, the test. 24:51 And God made it this way so that we would not worship the messenger. That's God's system. 24:58 If the messenger was perfect, then he would be god. 25:04 So, it doesn't make any sense. The messengers are just humans. Their only job is to deliver the message, to clarify. 25:11 They are sent as a mercy from God to give the information to the rest of us. So, they're going to make mistakes. 25:18 And again, this is to weed out those who would turn away because the messenger isn't perfect. Do you know the history of Moses? 25:29 And he went to Pharaoh and Pharaoh said, you know, "why should I listen to you? You stutter. You know, you're one of our slaves." 25:36 Even though, you know, Moses showed him all these miracles, it didn't make any difference. 25:42 But that was God's will. We have to believe God and now the messenger. And we know what happened. 25:51 The Christians, you know, who worshipped Jesus because it wasn't enough that he was a messenger. They wanted to make him a god besides God. 26:00 And it's the same thing with Muslims who worship Muhammad and they think that he was perfect. And there are all these myths and stories and legends about him that don't even make any sense. He was just a man. 26:13 And God is very careful in the Quran to point out his errors, too, not to scandalize him. 26:20 I mean, God doesn't get anything from that. But to make us realize that he was a man and don't worship him. He was just a man. 26:25 Listen to the message. It doesn't make any difference. The messengers all come with the same message, every one of them. 26:33 And it's God's intent that they do make mistakes and they are imperfect so that we won't worship them. 26:41 And to weed out those who will not listen to the messenger because they don't like him or they think that he's not perfect. 26:56 And the next verse is, again there isn't anything. We're all... we all need to help each other because we all have the same weaknesses. 29:35 And we're told here that once we get to the Day of Judgment, there are angels who never disobey God. 29:44 And every command will be carried out and nobody will have any power to do anything else. 29:53 And on that day, we'll be told, well, God willing, not we, but those who disbelieve will be told not to apologize, that they're just being repaid for what they did. 30:04 Again, it all comes back to us. He actually leads them astray. 30:23 If this is their decision, then He helps them in that decision. If we choose to believe, then He helps us in our belief. There's fear, confusion. And when you leave that into the light, then everything is made apparent to you. You know what's going on. Here, God, our God, gives us the relativity of the time. 3:54 He says a day, a day of your, a day of Heaven, Divinely day is equal to 50,000 years, your years. 4:13 In other words, we see that it may be 1,000 years. 4:18 These two different scales show us that time is not absolute, it is relative. 4:31 For example, I think everything is relative to us. For example, heat is relative to our heat. 4:45 We have 37 Celsius degree. If the weather is more than this, it is heat to us. 4:55 But if less than this, it is cold to us, the weather. You can ask yourself this question. Do you worry? 32:54 Number 2, do you become despondent when something bad happens to you? 33:00 Number 3, are you stingy when you have money? If you have these three traits, then you do not belong with the worshippers, the believers. 33:13 I remember my father's teacher had a debate with some of the mullahs. 33:19 And he trapped him into this. He said "do you worry a lot?" 33:24 He said "yeah, we're humans. We worry." He said "if something bad happens to you, do you become upset?" 33:30 He said "yeah, we're human beings, we do that." So, the lesson is that if you do observe your Contact Prayers, this will cool you down. You will not worry. You will have nothing to worry about. 33:55 No fear, no worry. And you will not be despondent when adversity happens. 34:04 You will remember what the Quran says that you may dislike something which is good for you. You may not get the job that you want, but God knows it is not good for you, and you accept that. 34:15 So, you will not be despondent. You will not be miserable because you didn't make it in the job interview. 34:22 So then, we have a bunch of traits of the believers. 34:27 They always observe their Contact Prayers, verse 23. 24, a specific portion, 2.5% of their net income is set aside for the poor and the needy, 25. 34:40 26, they believe in the Day of Judgment. These are all traits of the believers. 34:45 27, [70:27] They reverence their Lord's requital. They worry about it. In other words, they don't want it. They know how bad it is, just making God angry. 34:58 God doesn't get angry, by the way, but I mean, violating His commandments. 35:04 27 28 [70:28] Their Lord's requital is not taken for granted. 35:11 In other words, when you look at this, you'll be severe against yourself. You will not be lax. 35:21 You will judge yourself according to these criteria and make sure that you're a believer. 35:30 You will be strict with yourself. 35:36 Number 29, [70:29] They keep their chastity. So, I mean, you look at this verse 29 and you keep your chastity. 35:44 You'll not be lax or careless. 35:52 Keeping the chastity is something that is unusual in this country. Because the society evolved so much in the last few decades. Chasity. 36:05 Maybe, I should get you the piece of paper that Phil handed me. So, in other words, what happened in the last few decades is really very harmful to the people. 37:26 And we see what happened with AIDS, the spread of venereal diseases, 37:36 yes, lesbian mothers. Things that those born before 1945 never heard of these things. 37:43 But verse 29, the believers do not take it lightly, 29. 37:50 I'm writing an appendix on chastity and virginity for our children. 37:58 Our children better be different from the other children. It is your responsibility to teach your children for their own good that they must be virgin on their wedding night. 38:11 And I'm talking about boys and girls. And I'm going to show in the appendix how the happiness of your children depends on that. 38:21 The price is just too high if they don't follow this verse, this very short verse, 29. 38:31 [70:29] They keep their chastity. The price is really too high. 38:36 Now, even from the physiological and the physical point of view, the boys and the girls, when they mature first and they are ready for... they are not ready. 38:49 I mean, physiologically, they may have their menstruation, or they may... the voice may change, the boy's voice may change. 38:58 But physiologically and anatomically, they are not really ready for sex. 39:03 But in this country, they delve into sex without being ready, and they hurt themselves. 39:09 And they pay the price when they grow up. This is from the purely physical and physiological point of view. 39:16 But from the practical point of view, God sees to it that those who violate this... 39:23 Our boys and girls must be taught not to violate this. That they must keep their chastity, because when they do that, they pay from their happiness. 39:35 They will not have a happy marriage. They will not have a happy life. And, mind you, it is not easy. You must teach them that it is not easy to keep your chastity, especially in a society like this. 39:48 Joe Sobran is a reporter with the Los Angeles Times, and he had a wonderful commentary only yesterday, or the day before. 39:57 He says "these boys, they go out and they have sex as if there are no consequences. 40:03 But the consequences are abortions, dangerous things that happen to... And the children who have... 40:09 These boys have no intention of raising them or supporting them. They create a lot of misery." 40:16 That was Joe Sobran's commentary, and he is not a Muslim. But here we are reading the Quran, and God knows what is good for us. 40:22 He is telling us that the believers must keep their chastity. 40:33 You know, all of you are young, and you have children who are growing, and I want to repeat 40:40 and emphasize and re-emphasize that it is your responsibility. If you just do your part, God will do the other part. 40:48 You cannot just leave them to the world out there. You have to do your part by teaching them what the Quran is saying, what God is saying. 40:56 Because if you really love them, you want them to be happy when they grow up. And one source of misery will be to break these laws. 41:06 They are not physiologically ready. They'll be breaking God's law, and the price is too high. 41:16 And if you... I know you do want them to be happy. So, I'm going to write this appendix in detail, and you can use it. 41:26 OK. Use me to give them these instructions. It is very difficult to be a father or a mother, and you talk to children about sex. 41:37 It's kind of awkward. But if you use the Quran, tell them "this is what God says. Here is the appendix, read it." 41:44 And God will help you and will protect them. 41:50 So, and emphasize to them that it is not easy. You must exert, tell them they'll have to exert a lot of control. 41:57 Because the temptation is so great out there. And you are helping them this way when you tell them "it is not easy." But you must exert for your own happiness and your own good. 42:07 You must exert a lot of control. You must resist. You know, they have a big thing saying, "say no to drugs." But you never say "say no to sex." 42:16 Even though it is disastrous. 42:25 Subhan Allah. OK. 42:33 Yes, this is a shock. 42:44 Yes. The messenger: Because this, I think it was Valentine's Day at the university, and they distributed free condoms. 42:51 It's like telling them "go have sex," you know. They don't realize what they're doing and how much unhappiness they're causing to these kids. 43:00 But this is good news. Now, God is forcing. This is good for us. 43:15 There is a big campaign in the country against alcohol. They don't do it because God said so. I mentioned it before. 43:40 And it lists unbelievable disastrous health problems from alcohol. 43:46 Because it dissolves your brain. God created us and knows what is good for us. Believers children are in God’s hand. 45:03 So, if you think I spend too much time on this, it's deliberate. Because you have a lot of responsibility. Apamea: IN SHAA ALLAH. The messenger: Ok. 1:03 Apamea: Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem أعوذ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ 1:08 Apamea: Sura 71, Noah. [71:1] We sent Noah to his people: "You shall warn your people before a painful retribution afflicts them." 1:17 [71:2] He said, "O my people, I am a manifest warner to you. [71:3] "To alert you that you shall worship GOD, reverence Him, and obey me. 1:26 [71:4] "He will then forgive you your sins and respite you for a predetermined period. Most assuredly, GOD's appointment can never be delayed, once it is due, if you only knew." 1:37 [71:5] He said, "My Lord, I have invited my people night and day. [71:6] "But my invitation only increased their aversion. 1:44 [71:7] "Whenever I invited them to be forgiven by You, they placed their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their clothes, insisted, and turned arrogant. 1:53 [71:8] "Then I invited them publicly. [71:9] "Then I proclaimed to them loudly, and I spoke to them privately. 2:00 [71:10] "I said, 'Implore your Lord for forgiveness; He is Forgiving. 2:07 Apamea: Should I go ahead read the whole thing? The messenger: You're the boss. 2:14 [71:11] "'He will then shower you generously with rain. [71:12] "'And provide you with money and children, and orchards, and streams.'" 2:19 [71:13] Why should you not strive to reverence GOD? [71:14] He is the One who created you in stages. 2:25 [71:15] Do you not realize that GOD created seven universes in layers? [71:16] He designed the moon therein to be a light, and placed the sun to be a lamp. 2:35 [71:17] And GOD germinated you from the earth like plants. [71:18] Then He returns you into it, and He will surely bring you out. 2:43 [71:19] GOD made the earth habitable for you. [71:20] That you may build roads therein. And then there is a scientific miracle that Apamea didn't emphasize enough, or maybe didn't notice. 21:19 In 16, God says, [71:16] He designed the moon therein to be a light, and placed the sun to be a lamp. 21:26 There's a difference. A lamp is a source of light. 21:32 But if I have a mirror here, and the mirror reflects this light, the mirror will give light. 21:37 I can send light to that dark room over there, but the mirror will not be a source of light. 21:42 So, it's very clear in verse 16. 21:49 God is telling us, and this is consistent throughout the Quran, that the sun is a source and the moon is reflective. 21:55 The material of the moon is very special. This grayish material is very reflective. And this is what Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin said when they landed on the moon. 22:07 They held it in their hands, in their gloves, excuse me, and they said "it's quite reflective." 22:13 It's a strange material, but God made it that way. The reproductive cells are exactly half of the regular number of chromosomes. 26:28 So, if you take a cell from anywhere, it has 46 chromosomes. But if you look at the reproductive cells, it has 23. 26:41 Two reproductive cells get together to make a new human being, a new creature, whatever the creature is. 26:48 I mean, who designed that? Yuksel's Exposure 01 25 1990 Behrouz: Alhamdu Lillah, Wa Ash-hadu Alla Elaha Ella Allah Wahdahu La Shareeka Lah. 0:11 Behrouz: The reason for this Khutba is because we had a visitor from San Francisco. And 0:17 she came by to check us out and unfortunately she got shocked because of the way we were treating the God's messenger. 0:26 According from Quran, the verse is 6:8 says 0:33 [6:8] They also said, "If only an angel could come down with him!" Had we sent an angel, the whole matter would have been terminated, and they would not have been respited. 0:47 6 Chapter 6, verse 9 says, [6:9] Had we sent an angel, we would have sent him in the form of a man, and we would have kept them confused. 1:00 43:53 and 6:50 say the same thing, [6:50] Say, "I do not say to you that I possess the treasures of GOD. Nor do I know the future. Nor do I say to you that I am an angel. I simply follow what is revealed to me." Say, "Is the blind the same as the seer? Do you not think?" 1:24 6:158 says, [6:158] Are they waiting for the angels to come to them, or your Lord, or some manifestations of your Lord? The day this happens, no soul will benefit from believing if it did not believe before that. So, "Keep on waiting; we too will wait." 1:49 [2:210] Are they waiting until GOD comes down to them in dense clouds, with the angels? The whole matter will then be terminated, and to GOD everything will be returned.* 2:09 They are waiting for the angels, 16:33, [16:33] They are waiting for the angels to come to them, or until your Lord's judgment comes to pass. Those before them did the same thing. GOD is not the One who wronged them; they are the ones who wronged themselves. 2:27 11:12 [11:12] You may tend to disregard some of that which is revealed to you, and you may be annoyed by it. When they may say, "How come no treasure comes down to him, or an angel?" You are only a warner; GOD controls all things. 2:51 15:7 says, [15:7] "Why do you not bring down the angels, if you are truthful?" 2:57 15:8 says, [15:8] We do not send down the angels except for specific purpose. Otherwise, no one will be respited. 3:05 17:92 says, [17:92] "Or unless we cause masses from the sky to fall on us, as you claimed. Or unless you bring GOD and the angels before our eyes. 3:17 17:95 says, [17:95] "If the earth were inhabited by angels, we could have sent down to them from the sky an angel messenger." 3:27 [25:22] The day they see the angels, it will not be good news for the guilty; they will say, "We are irreversibly confused." 3:38 [43:60] If we willed, we could have made you angels colonizing the earth. 3:48 Behrouz: I wish to God that among us there would be anyone that would not believe in God's messenger 3:53 because God's messenger, Alhamdu Lillah, is alive and well among us and we just have to obey. 4:05 And constantly he goes around repeating "you have to believe in God and obey His messenger." 4:11 Right after "God" comes the word of messenger. You have to follow the messenger. 4:16 Excuse me. Usury as a practice... 13 Quran Study From Behrouz 313 Sura 7;12 By Rashad Adam & Eve's Body 12 24 1989 Dr. Khalifa: أعوذ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem The Test Begins. 0:07 [7:12] God said to Satan, "What prevented you from prostrating when I ordered you?" He said, "I am better than he; You created me from fire, and created him from mud." 0:24 So, this verse obviously is after the rebellion, and after deciding to give the human being 0:32 a body, this body that's made from the earth's material, and giving Satan a body made from energy, 0:40 or made from fire, literally. If you go many, many years before that, Satan thought he can be a god beside God, and this 0:54 created the different opinions among God's creatures in God's kingdom, where the vast majority upheld God's absolute authority, and the tiny minority agreed with Satan to different degrees. 1:08 And after that, God decided to call Satan's bluff, and make him, give him a dominion and constituents. 1:15 Those who agreed with him are to become his constituents, and the planet Earth is to become his dominion. 1:24 And the plan called for, in fact, this was after putting all those creatures to death. 1:32 And then, this verse here has to do with telling the angels that they will serve the human beings 1:45 on this earth. They drive the wind, guarantee the provisions, guard them, serve them, 1:52 because they serve us. Angels serve us, even though we are the rebels, and they are the ones who upheld God's absolute authority, but they are participating in the plan that God is carrying out. 2:04 And this is exactly why we were talking about this last night, where they beat up the disbelievers at the end. 2:13 Because they served them with the hope that they will come back to God's kingdom. 2:18 They will redeem themselves. They will repent. They'll apologize for the mistake they committed. 2:25 But then, when the life comes to an end, and the person is a disbeliever, then they beat him up, because 2:31 they served him all this life, they provided him with all the means to redeem himself, 2:39 but then at the end he died as an unappreciative of God. So, we understand all this by looking at this verse. 2:49 So, "what prevented you from prostrating" means you are not cooperating, you are not participating 3:00 in serving the human being. 3:06 This may indicate also that Satan did not want to guarantee the happiness and welfare of any human being. 3:14 He wanted to keep his options open, because he is supposed to act as a god, 3:22 meaning, he is supposed to make everybody happy and wealthy and healthy and perfectly alright. 3:29 But he didn't want this guarantee. He wants to be free to punish whomever he wills, persecute whomever he wills, and help 3:38 whomever he wills. So, this is why he did not prostrate before the human being. 3:49 When God told him that he will be a temporary god, this meant that he was supposed to take care of his constituents and make them perfectly happy. 3:55 So, maybe he wanted some exit in case he cannot do it. "oh, I'm just persecuting god." 4:03 But of course, his failure is glaring now. Number 13, [7:13] God said, "Therefore, you must go down, for you are not to be arrogant here. Get out; you are debased." 4:18 So, this is a confirmation of his dismissal from God's kingdom. Number 14, 4:26 [7:14] Satan said, "Grant me a respite, until the Day of Resurrection." 4:33 [7:15] God said, "You are granted a respite." [7:16] He said, "Since You have willed that I go astray,* I will skulk for them on Your straight path. 4:54 In this verse 16, Satan acknowledges that everything happens in accordance with God's will. 5:00 And it is God's will that we will, that we have a free choice. God willed that we will. 5:07 And that all His creatures will, because this rebellion indicates that God's creatures have freedom of choice. 5:15 In fact, the very first verse we read indicates that God's creatures can say "no." 5:24 God said "fall prostrate," and Satan said "no, I will not." So, it indicates, if this did not happen, we would never know that God's creatures have freedom of choice. 5:39 So, Satan said, in number 16 here, [7:16] ....."Since You have willed that I go astray,* I will skulk for them on Your straight path. 5:46 [7:17] "I will come to them from their front, from their back, from their right, and from their left, and You will find that most of them are unappreciative." 5:59 Okay, 17, 7:17, remember this verse, because you will see it. 6:06 We experienced it, and we see it all around us, that Satan comes to the human being from 6:11 his front, back, right, and left, and never runs out of tricks to divert us. 6:24 This place right here is his number one target. Because people come here, and what do they come here for? 6:31 They come here to worship God alone, uphold the word of God alone. This is exactly what Satan does not want. 6:37 And he will put up all kinds of obstacles, and all kinds of tests, persecutions, in many, many different and strange ways. 6:54 It is good, because this guarantees that all God's people are solid believers. Satan wants to show “some humans are worse than Satan” example how people argue about Quranic letter counts. 7:01 They're unshakable, no matter what happens, or who says what. 7:10 [7:17] "I will come to them from their front, and from their back, and from their right, and from their left, and You will find that most of them are unappreciative." 7:18 I think one of Satan's objectives is to show God that some humans are worse than he is, than Satan. 7:26 And it's true. Some humans out-satan Satan. 7:33 Satan is hoping that God may have mercy on him when He sees that some creatures are worse than he is. 7:46 I recall this fellow, when I was talking in Los Angeles, and this 7:53 professor at Chicago Seminary came out and gave a talk that the Quran is hallucinations by Muhammad. 8:00 And immediately after him, I gave a talk that the Quran could not be the word of human being. It has to be 8:06 the word of God, and here is the physical evidence. And I gave some details of the miracle, including the total of the numbers in the Quran. 8:18 When you take all the numbers mentioned in the Quran and add them up, the total is divisible by 19. They attacked me. 8:40 The guy who said "the Quran is hallucinations by Muhammad" is okay. Imagine a person staying a baby all their lives because of not feeding the soul. 1:00 That is very important. 1:07 I was gonna say "too bad that we don't see what happens to the soul because it is obscured 1:12 by the body," but you can imagine it. It's not too bad because this is God's design. 1:19 The test requires that things be obscured and hidden. 1:25 So, you rely completely on your logic and your belief, your faith. 1:33 So each one of us deserves congratulations for coming to this fantastic meal, feeding the soul, commemorating our God. 1:46 A'uzu Billahi Mina Shaytani Rajim أعوذ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ (We seek refuge in God from Satan the rejected) Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمٰنِ الرَّحِيْمِ (In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful) 1:52 Qul Huwallahu Ahad (112:1) قُلْ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ [112:1] Proclaim, "He is the One and only GOD. Allahu Samad (112:2) ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ [112:2] "The Absolute GOD. Lam Yalid Wa Lam Yulad (112:3) لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ [112:3] "Never did He beget. Nor was He begotten. 1:58 Wa Lam Yakullahu Kufuwan Ahad (112:4) وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌۢ [112:4] "None equals Him." Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمٰنِ الرَّحِيْمِ Qul Huwallahu Ahad (112:1) قُلْ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ Allahu Samad (112:2) ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ Lam Yalid Wa Lam Yulad (112:3) لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ Wa Lam Yakullahu Kufuwan Ahad (112:4) وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌۢ 2:13 Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمٰنِ الرَّحِيْمِ Qul Huwallahu Ahad (112:1) قُلْ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ Allahu Samad (112:2) ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ Lam Yalid Wa Lam Yulad (112:3) لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ Wa Lam Yakullahu Kufuwan Ahad (112:4) وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌۢ 2:25 Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمٰنِ الرَّحِيْمِ (In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful) Qul A'uzu Bi Rabbil Falaq (113:1) قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْفَلَقِ [113:1] Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak. Min Sharri Ma Khalaq (113:2) مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ [113:2] "From the evils among His creations. 2:32 Wa Min Sharri Ghasiqin Iza Waqab (113:3) وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ [113:3] "From the evils of darkness as it falls. Wa Min Sharri Naffasati Fil Uqad (113:4) وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّـٰثَـٰتِ فِى ٱلْعُقَدِ [113:4] "From the evils of the troublemakers. 2:39 Wa Min Sharri Hasidin Iza Hasad (113:5) وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ [113:5] "From the evils of the envious when they envy." Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمٰنِ الرَّحِيْمِ (In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful) 2:45 Qul A'uzu Bi Rabbi Nnas (114:1) قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ [114:1] Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of the people. Maliki Nnas (114:2) مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ [114:2] "The King of the people. Ilahi Nnas (114:3) إِلَـٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ [114:3] "The god of the people. 2:51 Min Sharril Waswasil Khannas (114:4) مِن شَرِّ ٱلْوَسْوَاسِ ٱلْخَنَّاسِ [114:4] "From the evils of sneaky whisperers. Allaziyu Waswasu Fi Suduri Nnas (114:5) ٱلَّذِى يُوَسْوِسُ فِى صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ [114:5] "Who whisper into the chests of the people. 2:57 Minal Jinnati Wa Nnas (114:6) مِنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ [114:6] "Be they of the jinns, or the people." At the time of Moses, magic was a big deal. 1:28 At the time of Jesus, healing the sick was a big deal. 1:34 At the time of Muhammad, the literary excellence was a big deal. That was the biggest number. Well, 50,000. 2:36 But then any multiples of thousand, anyway. So, how can you read this number? 2:42 12,692 digits. Congratulations. 17 Quran Study From Behrouz 717 Sura 90 & Sura 91 By Rashad Sura 82 & Sura 83 By Edip 07 21 1989No 7 أعوذ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ 0:09 Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful. 0:17 Dr. Khalifa: This morning about 9 o'clock, Lisa asked me "do you know that you're giving the Khutba? 0:23 It was quite a surprise as you realize. Then after the Khutbah, Lydia came to me and said "do you know you're giving the Quranic study?" 0:32 And she took the beating on behalf of Lisa. Actually, Lisa sent her to tell me that. 0:39 So, here I am. First of all, we welcome a new member to our masjid. 0:45 This person here. I forgot his name. 0:54 This is the former, and still is, Muhtesem Erisen, the one and only. Mã Shã Allãh Welcome back. Position of the Arms during Salat – does not matter. Direction of Qibla. 1:04 Before I start, there is also one more point that I wanted to mention. 1:09 Thanks to our Iranian brothers and sisters. There is a little bit of confusion now about your arms, what to do with your arms when you pray. 1:17 Keep them like this and put them straight down. I would like to establish first, once and for all, that it doesn't make any difference, 1:25 whether you go like this or put your hands down. But generally, what I do is I follow what the Imam is doing. 1:34 The person in the front, whatever the person in front is doing, I do what he's doing. And I recommend that for you. 1:47 IN SHAA ALLAH, we'll be doing Sura 90, The Town. 1:52 And whatever we can afterwards. At 8:30, the children will practice on us. 1:59 You know, they'll be singing at the conference. So, we'll give them maybe 20 minutes, 20 minutes to 9. 2:06 20 minutes enough? 20 minutes to practice a new song on us. 2:12 It should be enjoyable, IN SHAA ALLAH. 2:17 Sura 90, The Town. In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful. 2:23 [90:1] I solemnly swear by this town. [90:2] The town where you live. 2:31 [90:3] The begetting and the begotten. [90:4] We created the human being to work hard (to redeem himself).* 2:39 [90:5] Does he think that no one will ever call him to account? [90:6] He boasts, "I spent so much money!" 2:46 [90:7] Does he think that no one sees him? [90:8] Did we not give him two eyes? 2:53 [90:9] A tongue and two lips? Number 10, [90:10] Did we not show him the two paths? 3:00 [90:11] He should choose the difficult path. [90:12] Which one is the difficult path? 3:06 [90:13] The freeing of slaves. [90:14] Feeding, during the time of hardship. 3:11 [90:15] Orphans who are related. [90:16] Or the poor who is in need. [90:17] And being one of those who believe, and exhorting one another to be steadfast, and exhorting one another to be kind. 3:24 [90:18] These have deserved happiness. [90:19] As for those who disbelieved in our revelations, they have incurred misery. 3:31 [90:20] They will be confined in the Hellfire. So, that's the whole Sura. 3:38 I go back to the beginning, swearing. God usually starts many of these short Suras with a profound statement. 3:48 And this town, meaning Mecca, is profound. Because God made it sacred by putting His shrine there 3:56 to serve as the focal point. or a point of organization for all believers around the world. 4:02 When we stand in Prayer, we don't fight as to which direction we should face. 4:08 God already decided for us that we're gonna face the direction of Mecca. So, every believer, every Muslim around the world is praying and facing that point. 4:22 So, the first verse is simply a profound statement, as in many other Suras. 4:28 And it is the town where the Prophet Muhammad lived from whom this Quran was revealed. 4:35 "The begetting and the begotten" is a profound statement again. All these profound statements precede an important proclamation. 4:45 The begetting and the begotten, this is a profound fact of life. 4:54 Take for example birds. The bird laying an egg. 4:59 The egg has been fertilized by two parents, through two parents. 5:04 One half, a reproductive cell is half a normal cell. One reproductive cell from the male and one half, the other half comes from the female. 5:15 They combine to form an embryo. In birds, the egg is laid, it is fertilized. 5:21 And then, the fact that the birds sit on the eggs, you know they take turns, the male and female in most species. 5:32 Taking turns sitting on the egg. Why do they do that? Who taught them to do that? 5:39 And what's happening inside that shell, the egg? 5:45 After a period of time, that it is becoming obvious more and more that it's a multiple of 7. 21 days in some birds. 5:56 21, 7 times 3. The human fetus now is in the mother's womb 266 days. 6:04 It is now established scientifically. 266, not 265. 266 and that's 19 times 2 times 7. 6:12 That's still a multiple of 7. 6:18 Gestation period, is it called the gestation period? Is that the period inside the womb? 6:24 Ok. In many other species, I know it is a multiple of 7, but I'm being distracted now. 6:30 However, "the begetting and the begotten" is a profound statement. 6:35 After 21 days, the bird inside breaks through the shell and comes out. 6:43 Then, they're walking around. If they're ducks, they go in the water and they swim. You know, as if they've been here forever. 6:48 As if they know everything. Walking around, following their mother in the water. 6:54 You can go to a random spot and see them. They just came out of the egg. And they're full of wisdom, you know, just following the mother wherever she goes. And sometimes they go independently and pick at something in the water. “Created the human being to work hard to redeem himself” explained. 7:06 And they're identical to their parents. With beaks and eyes. Where did this come from? 7:15 And you can do this with any kind of species, any begetting and begotten. 7:22 Now here comes the proclamation. Number 4. [90:4] We created the human being to work hard (to redeem himself).* 7:31 As a result of that crime that we committed millions of years ago, 7:36 where we did not make a firm stand with God's absolute authority, we are here. 7:43 And God designed our plan to work hard, to redeem ourselves, to denounce that crime, 7:50 to prove that we are on the side of God's absolute authority. 8:00 What do you call getting up in the morning before sunrise? It's not easy, is it? At the beginning, especially when our soul is still small and weak. 8:08 The soul cannot wake up the body initially. Because the soul is weak. 8:15 It is hard work. And you are rewarded by growth, nutrition, and strength of the soul. 8:28 [90:4] We created the human being to work hard..... The lazy person who does not work hard and does not get up before sunrise, what is the result? 8:39 He or she ends up with a shrunken, weak soul that will not amount to anything in the real life, the Eternity. 8:50 They will be born into Eternity deformed. 8:56 And we see this in Sura 68 where they cannot fall prostrate. Dr. Rashad Khalifa Explains Initially difficult to do all prayers especially for the young. Missing prayers. 9:01 On that big day when God comes physically to our universe, they will not be able to, they have no legs. 9:08 I mean, this is symbolically. They are deformed. A stump cannot fall prostrate. 9:15 They are deformed. It is lack of growth. 9:20 To get up in the morning before sunrise and do the Morning Prayer is a gift from God. If we deserve it, God will guide us into waking up before sunrise to do the Morning Prayer. 9:34 For the young people, I don't want you to be alarmed because it may be difficult for you, but eventually 9:41 you will be able to train your body to get up in the morning before sunrise. If you are unable to do it now, don't be too disturbed. 9:51 It is normal. Let me tell you this because I don't wanna be too hard on you. It is normal to start out by doing one prayer a day. 9:59 Let us say the Morning Prayer as soon as you get up at 10 or 11 in the morning. 10:04 Then, it will be two prayers a day. Then, it will be three prayers a day. 10:10 Then, you will do the Morning Prayer before sunrise and you will enjoy it. 10:16 The ideal situation is to do the five Prayers with the Morning Prayer done before sunrise. 10:24 Also, God tells us in the Quran that we cannot do it every day. You're gonna miss once in a while. 10:31 So, always think of the positive and be glad, be happy with the achievements that you do. 10:37 If you miss one time a week or something, don't feel too guilty. Be glad that you did six out of the seven days, Morning Prayers before sunrise. 10:48 Ideally, you will not miss anything. The Arabic word is Muhkamat (مُّحْكَمَـٰتٌ), which there is nothing, no question about it. 4:51 You have to do the Salat. You have to pay the charity and things in that nature that 4:58 we saw it all through Sura number 2 which all of them were explained clearly, exactly that we know all about. 5:09 Then, God goes on saying "these straightforward verses are the essence of the scripture." 5:20 The essence of the scripture, I tried to read about it and this is something that we can discuss a little bit. 5:35 ...is, what it is in English, the essence of the scripture, I don't know how strong it is to an English speaking person. 5:44 But in Arabic it says Ummul Kitab (أُمُّ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ), which the literal meaning I think is the mother of all the books. 5:51 Can we say that? And then, we go to the multiple-meaning verses, which in Arabic they say Mutishabihat (مُتَشَـٰبِهَـٰتٌۭ). 6:03 These are verses that you can get confused or you can do the interpretation that you want to. 6:13 And then, God explains that those who harbor doubts in their hearts will pursue the multiple-meaning 6:19 verses to create confusion and to seek different meanings. This is the most interesting part of it because myself at least being a Muslim and being raised in an 6:33 Islamic environment, I can very easily, very soundly relate to this because this is 6:42 exactly what is happening. And we have felt it all throughout our lives, how these multiple-meaning verses 6:54 are becoming the essence of the scripture. And the essence of the scripture is put aside. 6:59 So, you see all the time an effort that is put into "understanding the Quran" is devoted 7:10 to the understanding of the multiple-meaning verses, the Mutishabihat (مُتَشَـٰبِهَـٰتٌۭ). 7:15 And then in that process, people completely forget about the essence of the major points of the scripture. 7:24 And with that they confuse the other people. And I don't have to go to specific examples of this, but you can see it everywhere. 7:33 I'm sure you can see it in other religions, but I have no idea of how those things are done, but 7:40 this clearly shows that how even Satan can use those multiple-meaning verses to divert 7:50 you from the major issue which are the essence of the book. 7:56 And then, God goes on and says "no one knows their true meaning except God."
