You know how they count the stars? Just some of you do. But any way, they go out 46:04 in the night and take a picture of the sky, just take a picture and they put in the computer and 46:10 they count... the computer will count the number of the stars in that area in the picture and there's a formula that tells you what the circumference 46:19 from the inside of a circle is and then you can... you can tell from this picture how many are in the 46:26 whole circumference of the whole sky and you do this a hundred times and then you take the average of 46:34 a hundred times and you have exactly, almost exactly, the number of stars, a billion trillion of them. 46:41 And these are the ones that we see. Because of this... our Sun is in the next galaxy, you will not be able to see it because it is one of the dim stars. 46:52 What we're seeing are only the bright stars. This is... this is how we counted them. 46:59 [56:75] I swear by the positions of the stars. Because they are in perfect positioning, perfect orbits. They don't crash into one another. 47:17 There was something else also I wanted... the notes are here. 47:25 Are there any questions? 47:52 Right, right. We have two halves that are divisible by 19. So, what I'm doing here is just making them into a circle. Well, the upper half is a multiple of 19 and you have the 48:04 total number of verses at the end of each Sura. The lower half is a multiple of 19 and connecting them has nothing to do with 48:12 anything, but in the lower half, you have the number of verses at the beginning of every Sura. And so, their destruction was already written. 37:20 It was already predetermined. And when they went to Abraham's house, he gave them the greeting and welcome as a believer. 37:31 As we know, God commands us in the Quran to greet the people with a hearty greeting, with a, 37:37 to give people a sense of welcome. And they returned it. 37:44 But when he offered them the food, they didn't eat it. And at this particular time, in Abraham's culture, whenever you went to someone's house and 37:54 they offered you of their table and you did not eat it, this would arouse suspicion and sometimes fear. 38:00 Because a guest should return, a guest should, you know, eat of the offering that the host meant. 38:07 And he became somewhat worried as to who they were and what they wanted. 38:14 And as we see here, they told him not to be afraid. And I just, you know, like I said, I had to force myself not to question it, not to be hung up about it. 7:37 When we had that discussion about jinns in the Quranic studies, I just kept my mouth shut, you know, very different things. 7:44 But now, just in this last year, we found out what this is, and so this chapter has a totally different meaning. 7:52 And for the first time, I understand what it means. And we know now that the jinns are, you know, they have the same requirements. 8:02 There's other verses in the Quran that they have the same requirements that we do. Some of them believed in Jesus, and they believed in other things, and then they heard the Quran, 8:10 and they believed, and, you know, they have the same requirements that we do. 8:16 And they also have the same rewards that we do. You know, there are entities that we can't see. You know, we don't know. They can see us, but we can't see them. 8:25 And yet, the Heaven that's described here in later verses is for them, too. They have their own, but it's the same set-up as ours. It's exactly the same for them. 8:35 Like, you know, these creatures that are so important in this scripture that we don't know anything about. 8:41 And now we know that the jinns were those that, before creation, sided with Satan and 8:48 took a stand against God and believed that Satan could be a god besides God, that God could have partners, which is the ultimate blasphemy. 8:57 And they were banished, and they have a chance to redeem themselves as well. 9:03 And our job is to, you know, and I used to read about Satan and his troops 9:08 and generations of jinns and humans, that I didn't know, how do they, how do they come to be generations? 9:13 How do they multiply? How do they, you know, what do they do to reproduce themselves? 9:19 Now we know that a jinn is assigned to each one of us, and so their reproduction is, 9:25 it coincides with our reproduction, that each one of us is given a companion at 9:31 the time of our entry into this world, and we're in the same boat. We both sinned. 9:37 We both came to this earth with original sin. We both took a stand against God, the jinns more forcefully than we did, but we took the same stand 9:47 as not being for God, because there's only two ways. Either you're for or you're against, and we were wishy-washy, but basically we were against God. 9:55 We've both been given the chance to redeem ourselves. Thing is, the jinns took the definite stand. So, they're going to try to convert us to Satan's way of thinking and to the original sin that we committed. 10:08 So, we have to convert them. So from the time of birth, we're in this constant struggle with our jinn companion to convert them to righteousness 10:18 and to protect ourselves from falling into the path of the jinn. And It's a struggle. It's a struggle every day of our lives, and it just goes on and on. 10:27 And the blessing about knowing who your enemy is, is knowing what they are, what their goal is, 10:34 what their tactics are, so you can learn how to defend yourself. And that's what the Quran is, and that's where these blessings come from. 10:42 So, we know that. And to me, the greatest blessing of all is knowing that we do have original sin and we're bad. 10:48 You know, we were born bad, because we took the stand against God. So now that we know that, we know what we have to do. 10:55 We have to, just every day of our lives, try to redeem ourselves from that sin. 11:03 And the Quran is very specific about giving us the way to do it, and we know now, 11:09 we've heard it several times in Khutbas, that we have to ask ourselves every day "who is my god this week?" 11:15 Ok. God has recorded it while they forgot. God witnesses all things. 0:50 [58:7] Do you not realize that God knows everything in the heavens and the earth? Anybody is doubting that? 1:02:02 I go to the Masjid on 14th Street and do my Prayer. And since the time I Prayed... 26 Quran Study From Behrouz 1626 Sura 67 By Gatut Hamid Argues With Rashad Gatut: (We seek) refuge in God from the rejected devil. Bism Allah Arrahman Arraheem In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful. 0:07 We are in Sura 67, Kingship (Al-Mulk). 0:15 [67:1] Most exalted is the One in whose hands is all kingship, and He is Omnipotent. 0:23 Well, I have to stop here. The verse says very clearly that in God is all the Kingship. 0:33 So, Kingship means that He is the sole and the only authority in this whole universe. 0:41 And He is also Omnipotent according to this verse. We also learn from the Quran that God grants Kingship to whomever He wills, and He grants it to the believers. 0:53 In other words, we know that people who worship God alone and follow God's commandment alone, 1:03 God promised them that they will be sovereign, or. kings or queens on earth. 1:09 In other words, they have everything that they need. 1:14 Everything that they need will be in their fingertips without, you know, the headache of a celebrity 1:20 that we know, you know, needs bodyguards, protection from FBI, or you cannot go to Burger King 1:30 to eat if you want because that's the headache of being a celebrity. You have a prison on your own, but God's servants, the believers, have all this and can still 1:41 enjoy this, and they have anything that they want. And I think that's the biggest, you know, 1:46 even the richest person in the world cannot do that because they will go everywhere and everybody 1:53 or some people or some news reporter will follow them. You know, Sam Donaldson will follow them 1:59 and ask questions and all that. So, the believers don't have that kind of headache. 2:06 The same goes with the, you know, financial problems. 2:11 They don't need 10 million dollars, but they have everything that they need. They get good transportation. They get anything that they need, good clothings, without being, you know, 2:24 without worrying that the IRS will get into their pocket or something. Gatut: So,... Alhamdu Lillah. 2:36 So, God grants kingship to whomever He wills, and according to the Quran, that is the believers. 2:43 Verse 2, The Purpose of Our Life. We all know that the purpose behind creating us here in this life and the whole universe is 3:18 because billions of years ago, we doubted God's Supreme Authority. 3:25 In other words, there is one guy who said "well, I can be a god besides God." And we, all the human beings, this is before the creation of the heavens and the earth and, 3:35 you know, our stay here, we don't show our firm stand for God. 3:41 In other words, we said "well, this guy who was Satan, he may have a point." 3:47 In other words, "let's give him a try. So, God gave us the second chance to redeem ourselves and this is because of His Mercifulness. He knows what's gonna happen. 4:14 There's no future for Him because as far as He is concerned, everything is past. Everything has taken place. 4:20 Only He knew it. But we need to affirm to ourselves, in other words, on the Day of Judgment, 4:27 everybody will see with their own eyes that this is what they do, that they do not really believe or they are a real believer. 4:36 So, it is the human beings who need the affirmations. So, there'll be no excuses on the Day of Judgment. 4:46 And verse says that "He is Almighty, the Forgiving." The Most Gracious is the One who holds them in the air. He is Seer of all things. 27:57 Here God is talking about the law of aerodynamics. We learn from the Khutba today, which is actually one of the, for those who missed the Khutba today, 28:10 the video program that will be shown starting tomorrow or next week, everywhere is 28:17 is a very good example of how a 20th century or 21st century human being can appreciate 28:26 the facts that have been expounded in a book written 1400 years ago. 28:33 All this detail about everything that only 50 to 100 years ago, some human beings started to learn 28:40 has been in the Quran for 1400 years. And here we know that, first of all, the birds fly because God decided 28:51 them to fly using the shape of the wings and the body. And this kind of shape and principle a human being start to learn and then 28:59 they copy it and they make aeroplanes, they make helicopters with the same principle. In other words, how this 100 tons 747, for instance, can take off into the air. 29:10 Simply because the shape of the wing is such that when you move the object, there will be less 29:17 density of the air on top of the wing than below the wing. So, the whole thing will be lifted. 29:22 So, that's the same design that God has made for the birds' wing. This is the principle of aerodynamics that is not considered well known, but yet all this has been around for millions of years. 29:40 [67:19] Have they not seen the birds above them lined up in columns and spreading their wings? ... We know that the formation the birds fly, again this is also a principle from aerodynamics. 29:50 The birds, God teaches the birds to fly in a certain pattern because certain pattern will be the most efficient to reduce the drag. 29:58 We know that the drag is the biggest challenge for anything that moves in the air. And this kind of formation is now actually being copied by, for instance, if you see Thunderbirds 30:09 F-16 from the Air Force. They always fly in a certain pattern because that pattern will reduce the drag that 30:17 each particular plane will experience. Most of us probably know this principle when we drive in the interstate. 30:26 If you drive 70 miles per hour and there's 18 wheelers 70 miles per hour in front of us, we tend to follow them. Because 30:35 we're basically having a reduced drag by following them and we can consume... we can conserve more fuel by driving that way. 30:43 So, that's also a principle of aerodynamics and it's also mentioned in the Quran here. 30:51 Number 20. مجموع تکرار کلمه خدا (الله) تا آخر این سوره
= ۲۶۹۸
مجموع شماره آياتی که تا اینجا دارای کلمه خدا (الله) هستند
= ۱۱۸۱۲۳
